result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron M Kotlarek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Inform agent of all prescriptions. 
Sign releases for agent.

No Contact with Kohls Dept Stores or any witnesses listed in the criminal complaint. Attend a Criminal Thinking class. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. STAYED for use at agent's discretion.
To be completed within the 1st 6 months as a condition of probation. As directed by agent.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Aaron M Kotlarek in court with Attorney Vincent J. Bobot.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Becky Van Dam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an amended information. Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1 on amended information.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Bobot makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

6 MONTHS HUBER 

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR   **Transfer allowed to Milwaukee County**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: Kohls or any witnesses listed in criminal complaint
____Criminal Thinking course
____60 Hours of Community Service - to be completed within 1st 6 months of probation   

COSTS:  $253.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  30 Days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions -STAYED- (to be used at agent's discretion)
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 11, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Aaron M Kotlarek in court with Attorney Vincent J. Bobot.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bobot requests a plea and sentence date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 11, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Defendant to have no contact with any Kohls Department store or with any witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Aaron M Kotlarek in court with attorney Vincent J. Bobot.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for November 3, 2014 at 09:00 am.
